content: oolongtea shawl by @red teapot atelier 1 hi there materials required after making all kinds of triangular shawls hobbii rainbow 8/4 cotton 1200 from simple to very complex it was just meters divided in any number of natural for me to design my first crochet assorted colors for the full version shawl… and here s the result or one single sultan deluxe cake 1000 meters for the smaller one this is not a beginner s pattern but i ve matching crochet hook tried to add as much detail as possible and tapestry needle to sew ends step-by-step pictures for every row scissors keeping the stitch count is really important with this kind of project so i ve added the stitches used in this pattern stitch count to every row as well slip_stitch slip_stitch yarn & hook size for the step-by-step chain chain pictures i used hobbii rainbow 8/4 cotton double_crochet double_crochet with a 3mm hook but you can use treble_crochet treble_crochet whatever yarn & hook size you like as long front post double_crochet fpdc as they match and you are happy with the back post double_crochet bpdc resulting gauge 3 double_crochet crocheted together dc3tog gauge 10 double_crochet in 5 cm other abbreviations difficulty intermediate chain-space chain separator terminology us terms skip st skip stitch some color combination ideas note the ones i show below are hobbii rainbow and hobbii friends cotton 8/4 because that s the yarn i frequently use but feel free to use any other brand you like shades of brown and burgundy hobbii rainbow cotton 8/4 in colors 08 07 06 88 63 47 64 2 a pink gradient hobbii friends cotton 8/4 in colors 42 41 47 46 45 and hobbii rainbow cotton 8/4 in colors 44 50 51 from lavender to turquoise hobbii friends cotton 8/4 in colors 73 92 91 89 and hobbii rainbow cotton 8/4 in colors 71 33 91 would you like to receive color combination ideas and inspiration for your own crochet projects click here to join my newsletter or navigate to https //redteapotatelier substack com/subscribe i will send a monthly email with ideas to mix and match colors and any updates on pattern releases you can unsubscribe at any point if you want try it out important note this pattern has lots of images and diagrams which i believe help to better understand the stitches but it s quite long if you prefer a print-friendly version scroll down and you will find a text-only description below some considerations this pattern is crocheted in row in every row you must crochet all the stitches in one side then 2 chain in the middle in the triangle vertex and then all the same stitches in reverse order at the end of each row you must turn your work the first and last stitches in every row are treble stitches treble_crochet i prefer to crochet my triangle shawls this way because it reduces the gauge and the triangle s base is flat instead
